oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Second-order correlations in an exciton-polariton Rabi oscillator
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rubo, Yuri G.
Sheremet, Alexandra
Kavokin, Alexey
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Mesoscale and Nanoscale Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We develop the theoretical formalism to calculate second-order correlations in dissipative exciton-polariton system and we propose intensity-intensity correlation experiments to reveal the physics of exciton-light coupling in semiconductor microcavities in the Rabi oscillation regime. We predict a counter intuitive behaviour of the correlator between upper and lower polariton branches: due to the decoherence caused by stochastic exciton-photon conversions this correlator is expected to decrease below 1, while the individual second-order coherence of upper and lower polaritons exhibits non-monotonous bunching.
